text: Gh≈çr (, (), also spelled Ghowr or Ghur, is one of the thirty-four provinces of Afghanistan. It is in central Afghanistan, towards the northwest. The capital of Ghor is Chaghcharan. About 635,302 people live in Ghor Province. ==Districts== Districts of Ghor ProvinceAfghanistan Geographic & Thematic Layers District Capital Population Area Notes Chaghcharan 132,442 Sub-divided in 2005 Charsada 30,079 Created in 2005 in Chaghcharan District Dawlat Yar 33,364 Created in 2005 in Chaghcharan District Du Layna 38,654 Created in 2005 in Chaghcharan District and Shahrak District Lal Wa Sarjangal 92,800 Pasaband 92,356 Saghar 30,497 Shahrak 57,888 Taywara 82,287 Tulak 44,935 ==Politics== ===Governors=== The current governor of Ghor is Sayyed Mohammad Eqbal Munib. ==References==
title: Ghor Province
